content:
I do not have personal experiences with taste, but i can provide information based on research.

it is true that seafood is usually fresher and more abundant in coastal areas, as they are situated near the source of the seafood. as a result, people living in coastal areas tend to have greater access to a wider variety of fresh seafood than those living in landlocked areas.

however, this does not mean that seafood in landlocked areas necessarily tastes worse. in fact, many landlocked cities have access to quality seafood that is flown in fresh daily from coastal regions, or is sustainably farmed nearby. with advances in transportation and shipping, it is possible for even inland areas to have high-quality, fresh seafood year-round.

ultimately, the taste of seafood depends on a variety of factors, including freshness, quality, and preparation. if the seafood is fresh and prepared properly, it can taste just as good in a landlocked city as it does in a coastal town. additionally, the cooking method and ingredients used in the preparation of the seafood will also play a role in its flavor, so it's important to consider factors like seasoning, sauce, and accompanying side dishes.
